usefulItems: silicone bread mat, plastic wrap, rolling pin, bowl, 2 baking trays (30 x 40 cm), baking paper, pastry brush, refrigerator, oven
title: Broccoli mustard pasties

ingredients.content: 300 g unsalted butter, cut into small pieces (1-2 cm) and frozen
300 g plain flour, plus extra for flouring
180 g cheddar cheese, cut into cubes (3-4 cm)
150 g mozzarella cheese, cut into cubes (3-4 cm)
80 g brown onion, cut into halves
100 g swede, peeled and cut into quarters
1 tsp English mustard, plus extra to serve
2 tsp Dijon mustard, plus extra to serve

preparations.content: Place all pastry ingredients into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>.
Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or floured work surface, then shape into a ball and flatten into a rough square. Wrap pastry in plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 20 minutes.

Unwrap dough and place onto silicone bread mat or floured work surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough into a long rectangle (approx. 60 x 20 cm). Fold dough into thirds and turn folded dough a quarter turn to the left. Repeat rolling, folding and turning two more times. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 20 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cheeses into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, swede and oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then cook <b>4 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add mustards, broccoli and salt and mix <b>5 sec//speed 4.5<b>.
Add reserved grated cheeses and mix <b>5 sec//speed 5<b>.
Preheat oven to 190°C. Line 2 baking trays (30 cm x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Remove dough from refrigerator. Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Roll each portion into a circle (20 cm). Divide broccoli mixture between 6 portions and place mixture into the centre of the pastry. Fold pastry over into a half circle shape to enclose filling, crimping edges with a fork to seal. Transfer pasties onto prepared baking trays and place into refrigerator for 10 minutes.

Brush pasties with beaten egg and make a small incision into the top of each one. Sprinkle with poppy seeds, then bake for 25-30 minutes (190°C), or until puffed and golden. Serve warm with extra mustard on the side.

hintsAndTricks: The broccoli in this recipe provides a source of zinc.
